title: Lecturer/Senior Lecturer in Healthcare Management
text:
000042-15 
About Anglia Ruskin University: 
Our vibrant, modern University is gaining prominence both nationally and internationally and we have ambitious plans for our future. Our main campuses in the cities of Cambridge, Chelmsford and Peterborough have been transformed with major capital investments. With an annual income of £190m and over 35,000 students, we are a major force for higher education in the East of England. 
About the role: 
The Faculty of Medical Science is the newest of our University’s five faculties. The Faculty builds on the strong national and international reputation of our flagship Postgraduate Medical Institute (PMI) and is committed to further developing our teaching, learning and research expertise in allied and public health, postgraduate medicine, healthcare sciences and management and leadership. As such, we are investing in new state-of-the-art laboratories and training facilities. 
The Department of Medicine & Healthcare Science are seeking a committed, motivated and experienced academic in Healthcare Management. You will be required to lead, deliver and further develop the MSc Healthcare Management and as necessary contribute to other undergraduate and postgraduate courses which have a healthcare management and/or leadership focus. As well as having extensive knowledge and experience of healthcare management and teaching experience at HE level you will be required to deliver curricula on line as distance learning as well as teaching face to face. 
With a PhD or nearing completion you will contribute to the departmental research strategies and demonstrate a commitment to our learning and teaching research. 
This appointment is subject to an enhanced level disclosure from the Disclosure and Barring Service. Further information can be obtained from https://www.gov.uk/disclosure-barring-service-check 
Please note that interviews are expected to take place on 25 September 2015. 
We value diversity at Anglia Ruskin University and welcome applications from all sections of the community. Share this job
